channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.description:
Report X-2024030438

  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The drum was being loaded onto an outbound trailer when it was dropped. It was secured by the lid and sent to quality control personnel. DescribePack: The lid on the drum was loosen and not tight enough to secure transport. Leakage would certainly occur upon transfer. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Kitty litter was placed to prevent the spread of leakage and prevent injury.

item.title: Report X-2024030395
item.description:
Report X-2024030395

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: NEWBURGH
  • State: NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA WAS CALLED TO THE TRAILER TO CHECK ON LEAKING PACKAGE UPON FURTHER INSPECTION QA REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM TRAILER AND STARTED TO PROCESS THE DAMAGED HAZMAT DescribePack: THE 2 OUT OF THE 4 BOTTLES INSIDE HAD LOOSE CAPS WHICH CAUSED THE LIQUID TO LEAKOUT AND DAMAGE THE BOX THAT WAS HOLDING THE BOTTLES INSIDE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM THE TRAILER AND REPACKED IN A SALVAGE DRUM WHILE DAMAGE REPORTS WAS BEING DONE

item.title: Report X-2024030144
item.description:
Report X-2024030144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: UNIONDALE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON CONTENT INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD IN EACH PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z7R65991305109470. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT 7R6599, GOLDBELLY, 127 W 26TH ST., SUITE 1000, NEW YORK NY 10001.

item.title: Report X-2024030183
item.description:
Report X-2024030183

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: EAST ELMHURST
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had arrived to our station in a damp state. QA and management team isolated the package due to potential damage. Upon inspection, it appears that their are 4 bottles of hydrogen peroxide that had loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused the contents to spill in the fiberboard box. DescribePack: Package failure was due to the hydrogen peroxide bottles having loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused a spill at the bottom of the fiberboard box. The spilled contents stayed within the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Management team placed clear bags and absorbent pads around the leaking package. After the spill was contained, management team placed the damaged HazMat inside of a red HazMat bin and placed the package inside of the HazMat cage for further processing.

item.description:
Report E-2024030142

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: ROTTERDAM JUNCTION
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AFTER LEAVING SHIPPER LOCATION DRIVER NOTICED SOMETHING ON SIDE OF TANK. DRIVER INVESTIGATED AND DISCOVERED WASHOUT CAP WAS MISSING. IT APPEARS LOOSE CAP VIBRATED OFF AND SMALL AMOUNT OF PRODUCT WAS RELEASED AS A RESULT OF MOVEMENT. DRIVER REPLACED CAP CLEANED MATERIAL FROM TANK AND MADE DELIVERY WITHOUT ADDITIONAL INCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2024030004
item.description:
Report X-2024030004

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: UNIONDALE

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON CONTENT INSPECTION WE FOUND LESS THAN FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD INSIDE EACH PACKAGE. THERE ARE NO DRY ICE MARKINGS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z7R65991330053287. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 7R6599, GOLDBELLY, 127 W 26TH ST, SUITE 1000, NEW YORK NY 10001. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024030203
item.description:
Report X-2024030203

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-13
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being off loaded from a trailer when it was dropped, and it landed upside down causing the tops of the containers to come loose and cause a slow leak from the containers. DescribePack: The tops of the containers are loose, and the box shows signs of a slow leak from the contents inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was discovered to be leaking the package was placed inside a hazmat tote and was placed inside the hazmat cage. Most of the liquid was confined to the box and ant liquid that came out was absorbed by cardboard that was placed down.

item.title: Report X-2024030150
item.description:
Report X-2024030150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming back to the station because it was unable to be delivered. The package was staged on the middle of the truck shelf, and it fell off causing the tops of bottles to come loose and the bottles leaked out. The driver immediately put down cardboard to soak up the spill and the box was placed inside a plastic tote and was returned to the station and placed inside the hazmat cage. All liquid which spilled inside the delivery truck was cleaned with old cardboard and was placed inside ethe salvage drum with the damaged product. DescribePack: The tops of the four bottles are missing and the inner seals of the containers are open from the fall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cardboard was used to soak up all the spilled liquid and the bottles was turned right side up.

item.title: Report X-2024030205
item.description:
Report X-2024030205

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: MASPETH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being loaded into the delivery vehicle and it was dropped causing the tops of the containers to come loose and cause an inner leak inside the box. When it was discovered that the box was leaking absorbent and cardboard were placed down and the package was placed into a plastic hazmat tote and placed into the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The containers have loose caps, and the box shows visible signs of leakage, and it has two baseball size holes on the left and right side of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent and cardboard were placed down to absorb any liquid that came out of the box.
